abstract.para: A system's FQDN is the absolute name returned by the resolver(3) library when queried for the local hostname. It represents the complete hierarchy of the host, typically formatted as the hostname appended with the DNS domain name, for example; test.example.com.

important.para: It is recommended not to set FQDN as the hostname in the /etc/hostname file , as it violates RFC 1178. For more information, refer: . You can define FQDN in the /etc/hosts file.

topic.para: To configure FQDN, you can use the command-line or directly edit the specific files.
